description: Learned borrowing from Latin phagedaenicus, itself borrowed from Koine Greek φαγεδαινικός (phagedainikós), from Ancient Greek φαγέδαινα (phagédaina, “phagedena”).

adjectives.description: phagedenic (comparative more phagedenic, superlative most phagedenic)

examples: The latter is a phagedenic ulcer of the bark, very destructive to young apple-trees  […] .
